results.title: Captain Socceroo 2-Individual Skills Coaching
results.brief_description: Individual skills coaching has 26 alternative coaching segments designed to assist the player who is practicing by himself without the aid of other players. Presented by John Doyle.

results.title: Captain Socceroo 1-Team Skills Coaching
results.brief_description: John Doyle presents his famous soccer skills segments in two cassettes. “Teams skill coaching” looks at 26 different soccer skills that can be practised by teams or several players together. Presented by John Doyle.

results.title: Captain Pugwash Seafaring Tales
results.brief_description: Attention me hearties! Here’s another chance to watch that bravest of buccaneers, Captain Pugwash, and his trusty band of pirates, in nine salty tales from the hugely popular 1960s and 70s series. Thrill to their swash- buckling adventures aboard the Black Pig as cunning cabin boy Tom helps Captain Pugwash and his loyal crew battle against their arch-enemy Cut Throat Jake. Their adventures involve an hilarious smuggling escapade, doughnuts for dodos and even a promising career in the theatre … but is it the end for Captain Pugwash when he faces the chopper? Rated: G

results.title: Captain Noah and his floating zoo
results.creator_credit: Brian Cosgrove, Peter Clark, Bridget Appleby, Douglas Terry and Granada Television International
results.brief_description: The story of Noah and his Ark, told in words, animation and music. God had created a world and set mankind on it, but when He looked down on His people He saw only sinning and selfishness. But He found Noah, the only good man left, living outside the walls of Fun City, and told him in a dream what He was going to do. Music by Joseph Horovitz and lyrics by Michael Flanders.

results.title: Captain James Cook
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Collings, Bern Gandy and Shell Film Unit
results.brief_description: Retraces the voyages of Captain Cook along the east coast of Australia from Mallacoota Inlet to Cape York, and contrasts Cook’s comments with the developments that have since taken place. Gabo island, Botany Bay, Brisgane, Bustard Bay and Rockhampton, Magnetic Island, Cape Tribulation, the Endeavour River and the present Cooktown. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: Captain Huff and Harry: problem solving - consumer mathematics
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Aesop Films
results.brief_description: To fix her broken ship Captain Huff must buy new rivets and a rudder. At the store she uses a calculator to make unit price comparisons, a 10% discount, sales tax and delivery charges. An animated film. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Captain Horatio Hornblower
results.creator_credit: Ken Adam, Raoul Walsh and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: C.S. Forester’s Napoleonic era naval hero, Captain Horatio Hornblower is made larger than life by an excellent performance from Gregory Peck. This is an epic film with plenty of broadside action and cannon fire as Hornblower’s man-o-war takes on the French and Caribbean pirateers. Hornblower’s sterness is eventually softened by true love in the guise of Lady Barbara Wellesley (Wellington’s sister), played by Virginia Mayo. This is an exciting, action-filled film with an eye for accurate historical detail.

results.title: Captain Feathersword the friendly pirate
results.creator_credit: Chisholm McTavish, Paul Field and Wiggles Touring Pty Ltd
results.brief_description: Come and dance and have lots of fun with Captain Feathersword and his friend The Wiggles, Wags the Dog, Dorothy the Dinosaur, Henry the Octopus, Officer Beaples and his pirate shipmates. Take a trip down memory lane with the Captain as he tries to teach old Wags the Dog some new tricks (and Wags teaches the Captain some magic), dances with his nephew, Captain No-beard, and follow the Wiggles as they help the Captain learn to count to ten!
results.creator_credit_for_label: Chisholm McTavish, Paul Field and Wiggles Touring Pty Ltd

results.title: Captain Cook safari
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Thompson, General Motors Holden and Cine Service
results.brief_description: General Motors Holden’s trial drivers and a Brisbane T.V. team travel from Brisbane to Cooktown in four new production model vehicles, to commemorate the bi-centenary of Captain Cook’s 100 days on the Queensland coast. They visit the points where Captain Cook’s expedition landed in 1770. Shows the different terrain and driving conditions in route. Narrated by Geoff Raymond and photographed by Ken Jacoby.
